name: Kali nitricum
Relationship: Antidotes: OPIUM; NIT. SP. DULC.Antidote to Opium and Morphine poisoning, 8-10 grains to glass of water.Compare: GUN-POWDER (Nitre with sulphur and charcoal - 2X trit. Blood-poisoning. Septic suppuration. Protractive against wound infection. Antidote to Ivy and Primula rash (Clarke). HERPES FACIALIS; crops of boils. Carbuncles). Osteomyelitis. CANNAB. SAT. (Which contains a large amount of KALI-NIT.). LYCOP.; SANGUIN.; ALLIUM. SAT.; ANTIMON. IOD.
Modalities: Worse: eating veal; towards morning and in afternoon

Heart: Violent stitch in precordia, and beating of heart
Respiratory: Asthma, with excessive dyspnoea, nausea, dull stitches, and burning in chest
Dry, morning cough, with pain in chest and bloody expectoration
Bronchitis, with sharp, short, dry, hacking cough
Acute exacerbations in phthisis; congestion of lungs
Expectoration of clotted blood, after hawking mucus
Dyspnoea so great that breath cannot be held long enough to drink, though thirsty
Head: Headache, with vertigo, as if falling to right side and backwards; worse, stooping
Scalp very sensitive
Ennui
Female: Menses too early, profuse, black; preceded and with violent backache
Burning pains in the ovarian region only during menses
Mouth: Tongue red, with burning pimples; burns at tip
Extremities: Tearing and sticking in shoulders and joints

details: Often indicated in asthma, also valuable in cardiac asthma; of great value in SUDDEN DROPSICAL SWELLINGS OVER THE WHOLE BODY. Gastrointestinal inflammation, with much debility, and relapse in phthisis, call for this remedy. Suppurative nephritis.
